qas.question: How did Eisenhower describe his political views?
What New deal program did Eisenhower particularly support?
What cabinet agency did Eisenhower make Social Security a part of?

answers.text: Department of Health, Education and Welfare

qas.question: How many people were added to the Social Security rolls by Eisenhower?
What policy in regard to the military did Eisenhower see to completion?

context: Throughout his presidency, Eisenhower adhered to a political philosophy of dynamic conservatism. A self-described "<a0_0>progressive conservative<a0_0/>," he continued all the major New Deal programs still in operation, especially <a1_0>Social Security<a1_0/>. He expanded its programs and rolled them into a new cabinet-level agency, the <a2_0>Department of Health, Education and Welfare<a2_0/>, while extending benefits to an additional <a3_0>ten million<a3_0/> workers. He implemented <a4_0>integration<a4_0/> in the Armed Services in two years, which had not been completed under Truman.
